comments.body: IIUC, the way of fetching LOCAL node IPs got changed - we no longer use the `ip route show ...` command, right? So, we should change the comment as well.
Actually, we still using `h.RouteListFiltered` to show routes, which equivalent to exec `ip route show...`, what changed is the way we filter routes that we don't want.
But I think this comment can be simplify.

Oh, I think I get it. But...we can keep optimizing this piece code without using `ip route show`, e.g. 

```
link, err := h.LinkByName(dev)
addrs := link.Attrs()
```

We can improve it in another PR.

this error log is `return value`, will not print out directly, so I think `error` should keep in `lower-case` word. Just like other function's log format in this file , `EnsureAddressBind`, `UnbindAddress` ...
same reason of `error get`,  I think `error` should keep in `lower-case` word.

Believe me, I am 100% want to add tests.

The reason why I didn't do that is I am unable to do that.  `GetLocalAddresses()` will revoke `netlink.LinkByName()` to get a REAL network interface and `netlink.RouteListFiltered()` to list REAL route table.  In order to testing them, I have to create a REAL network interface and give the test code root privilege.  Unfortunately, the UT codes run in upstream CI can NOT acquire such privileges. Am I missing something?

Or, Should we check the user id before running tests? e.g.

```
if user.Current().Uid == 0 {
  do test
}
```

??

It seems odd.
In my view, we can add tests for the caller side: `NodeIPs()`?
